FuncDef:
The peer tcp-mss command configures a TCP MSS value used when the local device establishes TCP connections with a peer.
The undo peer tcp-mss command deletes the configured TCP MSS value. The peer tcp-mss command configures a TCP MSS value used when the local device establishes TCP connections with a peer. The undo peer tcp-mss command deletes the configured TCP MSS value. By default, no TCP MSS is configured for the local device to establish TCP connections with a peer.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the TCP MSS value used for TCP connection establishment.
The value is an integer ranging from 176 to 4096, in bytes.

ExtraInfo: You can run the peer tcp-mss command to configure a TCP MSS value used during TCP connection establishment with the specified peer. The value ranges from 176 to 4096 and is used to fragment TCP packets when the path MTU is unavailable. Such configuration improves network performance.
